In the military, it's basically an expected custom to greet all superiors with a greeting of the day. It's either Good Morning, Good Afternoon, or Good Evening. Walk past your Sergeant Major without saying this and see how fast he hems you up.
So, unless dad there thinks all the military is gay, and judging by his overblown machismo I don't think he would, there is nothing wrong with that greeting.

name: TerryTowellinghat
comment: I’m 50 now. My dad is 78. We get along fine these days. I can remember two times he basically told me I’m giving off gay vibes. One was when he told off for standing with my hands on my hips. Apparently that was gay. The other one really hurt at the time (I got over it almost immediately) but he told me off for picking up my beer near the rim rather than at the base. Gay. I think it hurt because I was enjoying a dad-bonding moment at the time which was a moment for me at 18. There was another time much later.when I mentioned that the grandson of an elderly friend of ours was a ridiculously good looking guy. Sure it sounds gay but it really wasn’t. The downside was that although he didn’t say anything at the time, he chose to bring it up when this guy was present a few months later. I’m totally not gay. This guy was undeniably model good looking while working as a cowboy and mine electrician pulling down stacks and playing rugby on the weekend. Dad was diagnosed with alzheimers a few years later and this probably should have been my first warning.

name: BrotherAmazing
comment:
Possible explanations:
Dad is homophobic and the events occurred just as described and we imagine
Dad is homophobic but the events occurred a little differently than we imagine. For example, son said ‘Good morning!’ like he was Richard Simmons very emphatically, but that greeting could mean many things that are not “gay” (happy cult members in “happy cults” do this sometimes, for example) and dad just homophobic.
Less likely but possible, Dad is still homophobic but the “gay” thing didn’t come out of nowhere and OP is really leaving some key elements out of the story. Like he licked his lips and stared at the man up and down and went “OooooOw! Hell-OH! Good Mornin’ sugar!” or something.
